title.rendered: New Abrams Ads Highlight Candidate’s Business Experience and Preparedness to Grow Georgia’s Economy

content.rendered:
ATLANTA – Today, Abrams for Governor launched a pair of new television and digital ads highlighting Stacey Abrams’ business experience and her preparedness to create an economy in which every Georgian can thrive.

Stacey is a Yale-trained tax attorney and small business owner. She co-founded NOWAccount, a financial services firm that helps Georgia small businesses grow their operations and create jobs. She is also CEO of Sage Works Productions, a production company in Georgia with several projects under development, including with CBS Studios and NBC/Universal. Stacey has a track record of creating jobs and supporting small business growth across the state and nation.

As a small business owner herself, Stacey understands the barriers to small business success, and as governor, she will invest in Georgia’s small businesses in every county to ensure they have the resources they need to grow and create jobs. Stacey has a vision for Georgia where prosperity is measured by how many of our families and small businesses can thrive. Read about Stacey’s plans for economic mobility and programs to help Georgia small businesses thrive, including her Small Business Capital Growth Fund, the Entrepreneurship Learner’s Permit, and the Georgia Commercial Investment Program here.

“Ms. Teresa” focuses on Stacey’s commitment to helping small businesses across Georgia with her mindset that small businesses are the bedrock of our communities and our economy. “Stacey Abrams helped small businesses make it through the pandemic,” the ad notes, highlighting Stacey’s work to support Ms. Teresa’s Macon restaurant. “She helps the community, she helps me, she helps everybody,” Ms. Teresa says.

“Superpower” centers on Stacey’s experience as co-founder of NowAcount, which helps small businesses access the capital they need to grow and create jobs. The ad features her business partner Lara, NowAccount co-founder, President & CEO, with whom despite their differences, they have worked together to create jobs. As FastCompany wrote, “the former tax lawyer and author is helping small businesses get paid.”

“Ms. Teresa” can be viewed here. A script follows:

MS. TERESA: I love cooking. That’s my passion. During the time of the pandemic, it was very hard for everybody. I was like ‘oh my God, what are we going to do?’ Then I got a phone call from Stacey Abrams.

MS. TERESA: Oh my God!
ABRAMS: How are you doing?

MS. TERESA: It just made my day. I’m telling you, she made a big impact on our community. She pulled people back together. They say Stacey’s a woman of her word. I say, ‘I know.’ She helps the community, she helps me, she helps everybody.

“Superpower” can be viewed here. A script follows:

LARA: When Stacey and I first met, we seemed like opposites.

ABRAMS: Lara talks to anyone.

LARA: Stacey listens to everyone.

ABRAMS: Lara’s an Independent

LARA: Stacey’s a Democrat.

ABRAMS: Lara’s more Star Wars.

LARA: Stacey’s Star Trek.

ABRAMS: We don’t always agree. But our differences

BOTH: they’re our superpower.

ABRAMS: We built a company together to finance other small businesses…

LARA: …and help them save and grow jobs.

ABRAMS: That’s how we’re going to grow Georgia’s economy.

LARA: That’s why you ought to be governor.

ABRAMS: We can agree on that!

###
